intro: Gynochthodes scabrifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf gynochthodes, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
